definition: to get an advance on one's pay
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

sentences.english: Please lend me a pen to write with.
All expenses or applications of expenses have to be approved by the budget holders.
sentences.chinese: 所有借支或费用报销均需由预算控制人审批。

sentences.english: May I please borrow a pen?
May I borrow the pen from you?
sentences.chinese: 我可以从你那借支笔吗？

sentences.english: Hello, Jane. May I borrow your pen?
sentences.chinese: 喂，简。能向你借支钢笔吗？

sentences.english: Excuse me, may I borrow a pen, please ?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我可以借支钢笔吗？

sentences.english: May I borrow a pencil, please?

definition: (accounting) to strike a balance/to reverse an entry/to write off
render an account/submit an expense account/apply for reimbursement
to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
